## Pythagorean Identities

\begin{align*}
1 - \cos^2 t &= \sin^2 t\\
1 - \sin^2 t &= \cos^2 t\\
1 + \tan^2 t &= \sec^2 t\\
\sec^2 t - 1 &= \tan^2 t
\end{align*}

---

$\displaystyle \int x^2\sqrt{x^2 + 9}\;dx$

---

$\displaystyle \int \frac{1}{\sqrt{x^2 - 9}}\;dx$

---

$\displaystyle \int \frac{1}{x^2}\sqrt{7 - x^2}\;dx$
